text: May 2014 an undeclared war rages in the
Ukraine the conflict attracts the
attention of military and civilian

world one unusual picture arouses fears
of a deadly threat in the country's vast
dark forests it looks like some kind of
badly drawn Neolithic chalk carpet what
I see is a large area that is whited out
but you're not sure as to exactly what
it is the image comes from an area of
central Ukraine near the border with
Belarus
the white shape looks artificial but
it's in a patch of isolated forest the
closest buildings belong to a ghost town
devoid of human life
this is one of the most contaminated
places on earth in 1986 this area was
close to the site of a devastating

feared condition in the field of nuclear

explosion followed by this nuclear fire
burning for ten days many Chernobyl

considers the theory that the white

throughout the area

the lines are perfectly straight
expanses of brilliant white ground seen

create this white reflective metallic
shear and in fact there have been white

a key ingredient in advanced fire weapon
the Ukrainian military has been accused

so what else could it be close
examination of the white areas of the

why would someone tamper with this image
what are they hiding
high-definition satellite images are now
so widely available they can pose a
threat to national security the security
services of many countries respond to
the threat with a process known as
redaction images of sensitive locations
are modified before they're uploaded to
online mapping sites the white blotches
might be evidence that the Ukrainian
government has something to hide all
governments regularly do this they will
take the original satellite data and
they will alter it it keeps enemies from
being able to specify points of interest
intelligence sources suggest that many
redacted satellite images conceal
military installations this looks just
like a lot of the redaction that's done

on the ground in Ukraine is highly
volatile Russian backed separatists have
NX Crimea keeping military installations
from enemy view makes strategic sense
clandestine military bases are often
seen tucked away in remote parts of

activity but find none
there don't seem to be enough roads or
rail lines or even an airfield for it to
be a substantial military base research
into historical image archives produces
an unredacted photo of the same area the
older photograph reveals what is hiding
beneath the white blotches
it's a massive parking lot but why is it
there you see choppers and trucks parked

the deserted roadways of Chernobyl and

it's like a post-apocalyptic scene from

the school is in place the amusement

they've all been removed the Soviet
